column11: EVENT TEXT
column152: NEARBY SHIP DRONE CONTROL SYSTEM CAPACITY

column154: NEARBY SHIP DRONE CONTROL SYSTEM DAMAGE
column210: HULL DAMAGE NEEDED FOR ESCAPE ATTEMPT

column11: The data you carry is vital to the remaining Federation fleet. You'll need supplies for the journey, so make sure to explore each sector before moving on to the next. But get to the exit before the pursuing Rebel fleet can catch up!  TIP: Nebulas -  Passing through a Nebula will allow you to temporarily slow down the fleet advancement but they contain their own unique dangers.
They look like they don't want to fight. They are trying to escape.
Their ship breaks apart and you are relieved to know that you are still one step ahead of the fleet.
Thank you. Here, have this extra scrap as payment.
With the pirate ship destroyed, your ship's system is restored to full functionality. You salvage what you can from the debris.
The ship explodes, leaving behind a substantial collection of useful scrap material.
The ship explodes, leaving behind a substantial collection of useful scrap material.
You find yourself surrounded by a group of mysterious alien vessels. They hail you and apparently have some valuable technology for sale.
column12: Augment: FTL JUMPER, TELEPORT HEAL, SCRAP COLLECTOR, Weapon: LASER CHARGEGUN 2, BOMB STUN, BOMB FIRE,

column11: The outpost hails you, The pompous bastards expected free service just because they defeated the Federation. Take this for the help.
Great. Take this bit of fuel as a down-payment. We'll be one step behind you, following your jump signatures. Don't want to take any risks now, do we? Added a quest marker to the next sector!

The nearby planet shows sign of habitation and great beauty. A rudimentary automated planetary defense system is looping its message into space: Warning! Quarantine Level 5 in effect under FHA Act 22, article 11.2. Warning! Quarantine Level 5...
The ship explodes, leaving behind a collection of useful scrap material.
This sector was the site of many major battles between the Federation and Rebel fleets. Strangely, there's very little evidence of those battles remaining...
The ship explodes, leaving behind a substantial collection of useful scrap material.
Thank the heavens you showed up! We don't have much to offer as a reward, but our engineer should be proficient enough to patch your ship up a bit after that nasty fight.
The Slugs, taking advantage of the firefight, have fled the system. So much for gratitude.
You arrive at an empty space station, no doubt abandoned due to the Lanius threat. Life signatures are detected at the ship depot and you spot a few crude signs stating Everything Must Go!
column12: Weapon: MISSILES BURST, BEAM LONG, MISSILES BREACH, Crew: Lanius, Zoltan, Lanius, Augment: ZOLTAN BYPASS, FTL BOOSTER, SCRAP COLLECTOR,

column11: The survivor gets on board the ship.
The ship explodes, leaving behind a collection of useful scrap material.
There should be some extra junk metal in some cargo bay... You thank them once they transfer the scrap and prepare to move on.

You find the ship has a built-in method of warning the Rebel fleet of contact with your ship. You feed it some false data about your ship's whereabouts that should keep the fleet off your tail for a time.

You arrive to discover a number of Lanius ships docked at what appears to be a station. You hasten to leave but are relieved when they message you in your language. Buy? Sell? Traders. Apparently some merchants emigrated with the scavengers.

column11: You prepare to jump as soon as possible. You don't want to be around if they disable this beacon.

column11: This nebula must have been an important hub at one point; placing all of these jump beacons would be no easy task. However, now it's hardly navigable.

column11: There appear to be a number of small stations nearby. Before you have time to scan them, warnings go off. A Rebel teleporter was used in one of the stations. You've been boarded!
column70: ADV SCANNERS, CLOAK FIRE, SCRAP COLLECTOR

column11: From the bits and pieces you find, you decide that this ship was gathering information. Nothing seems useful.
column70: ADV SCANNERS, CLOAK FIRE, SCRAP COLLECTOR

column11: A ship engineer has set up a small shop here.

column11: You search the remains of the ship, but only come across blueprints and debris from broken machinery. A shame, but you take what scrap you can salvage.
column70: ADV SCANNERS, CLOAK FIRE, SCRAP COLLECTOR

column11: Seeing a trade depot set up near the beacon implies there is an alien settlement on some nearby rock. You decide to check out their wares.

column11: Searching the remains, you find that the cargo was military-grade Drone Schematics! You bring them aboard to install in your ship.

column11: This Long-Range Beacon is almost hidden within a nebula. When the FTL Drive is charged you can jump to the next Sector.
column70: ADV SCANNERS, CLOAK FIRE, SCRAP COLLECTOR

column11: The complex arrangements of ship hulls and FTL drive capacitors floating abandoned in space suggest the Engi were here not too long ago; but no longer.
column70: ADV SCANNERS, CLOAK FIRE, SCRAP COLLECTOR

column11: The Engi seem relieved, and eager to get underway. They set off without saying goodbye.
column70: ADV SCANNERS, CLOAK FIRE, SCRAP COLLECTOR

column11: Great. Take this bit of fuel as a down-payment. We'll be one step behind you, following your jump signatures. Don't want to take any risks now, do we? Added a quest marker to your map!

column11: A message arrives: Your scrap, ours. Our weapons for you. You're about to raise the shields when you realize it's just an Engi trader looking for a trade.

column11: They are thrilled with your success and offer you a reward.
The Engi can do remarkable things with just a pile of scrap. The Engi hive at this beacon are selling equipment for just that.
column12: System: battery, mind, hacking, Crew: Engi, Engi, Human,

column11: Debris from a battle is scattered around this system. A few pieces bounce against your ship. You passively scan them and discover there is a functioning weapon among them!
Thank you for rescuing us! They held us hostage to ambush unsuspecting passersby. Please, take this.
The ship explodes, leaving behind a substantial collection of useful scrap material.
You have arrived in Engi space. The fall of the Federation has brought tough times for these robotic lifeforms, but they're usually willing to help.
You can't risk fighting some unknown alien on every backwater station you come across. You prepare to jump.
Thank you for your business.
A message arrives: Your scrap, ours. Our weapons for you. You're about to raise the shields when you realize it's just an Engi trader looking for a trade.

column11: You let their team on board and after a short time they finish their work.

The Slugs that live in this nebula field are a leisure-centered civilization. Everything in Slug life is done in the pursuit of more currency and more time in which to spend it on extravagant ventures. This, inevitably, leads to much treachery in open space.

You overhear their conversation and learn they're planning to raid an infamous and likely wealthy pirate ship in the area. The pair jump off and you note down their target co-ordinates. Added a quest marker to the next sector!
